title: TC001-User Login with Valid Credentials
description: Verify user can successfully login with correct email and password via Supabase Auth.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Login Successful! Welcome to your dashboard').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: User login was not successful, or user was not redirected to the dashboard as expected. Valid session and JWT token creation could not be verified.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
Failed to go to the start URL. Err: Error executing action go_to_url: Page.goto: net::ERR_EMPTY_RESPONSE at http://localhost:3000/
Call log:
  - navigating to "http://localhost:3000/", waiting until "load"

title: TC002-User Login with Invalid Credentials
description: Verify the system prevents login with incorrect email or password and shows relevant error messages.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Login Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The system did not prevent login with incorrect email or password as expected. No error message for invalid credentials was displayed, or a session/JWT token was incorrectly created.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-Role-Based Access Control Enforcement
description: Verify each user role (admin, monev, viewer, program_planner, program_implementer, carbon_specialist) accesses only permitted features and data.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Full Edit and Upload Access Granted').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Role-based access control verification failed. Users do not have the expected permissions as per the test plan, indicating a failure in enforcing access restrictions for different user roles including admin, viewer, and others.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Data entry successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Monev users could not record target vs actual indicator data accurately or generate verifiable Monev reports as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
